questions.question_text: Jacky encrypts her documents using a password. It is known that she uses her daughter's year of birth as part of the password. Which password cracking technique would be optimal to crack her password?

discussion.content:
Given that Jacky uses her daughter's year of birth as part of the password, the most optimal password cracking technique would be:

D. Hybrid attack

A hybrid attack combines dictionary and brute force attacks. It starts with a dictionary of common words or known information (like a year of birth) and then adds variations (e.g., adding numbers, symbols, or different letter cases) to crack passwords that are based on predictable patterns or known personal information. This method would be efficient for cracking a password that includes a known element like a year of birth.
A. RBA use variations of words and known patterns to generate potential password combinations.

questions.question_text: Which of the following tool can the investigator use to analyze the network to detect Trojan activities?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D > Capsa is an intuitive network analyzer, which provides detailed information to help check if there are any Trojan activities on a network.
https://ktflash.gitbooks.io/ceh_v9/content/65_malware_detection.html
D. It is a packet analyzer developed by Colasoft for network administrators to monitor, troubleshoot and analyze wired & wireless networks.

questions.question_text: When a user deletes a file or folder, the system stores complete path including the original filename is a special hidden file called `INFO2` in the Recycled folder. If the INFO2 file is deleted, it is recovered when you ______________________.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. Reboot Windows

If the INFO2 file is deleted or becomes corrupted:

Upon rebooting Windows, the operating system will automatically rebuild the INFO2 file for any files currently in the Recycle Bin.

The file metadata is restored, but if files were removed from the Recycle Bin, their information will not appear in the new INFO2 file.

Selected Answer: B
The INFO2 file is automatically recreated when the Recycle Bin is accessed after a reboot, allowing for the restoration of deleted file records.

Selected Answer: C
C > This file is very important because if INFO2 becomes corrupted or removed, normally anything currently in the recycle bin could be lost lost unless you try to use a piece of data recovery software to get it back.
Read More: https://whatsoftware.com/what-is-info2-file-hidden-in-recycled-or-recycler-folder/

Restore the INFO2 file: If the INFO2 file itself was deleted from the Recycle Bin, you can attempt to recover it by restoring it from a backup or using file recovery software. This process depends on whether you have a backup of the Recycle Bin or whether you use file recovery software to restore deleted files.

 Check if you have a backup of the Recycle Bin. If you do, you can restore the INFO2 file from the backup to its original location.

 If you don't have a backup, you can use file recovery software to scan the drive where the Recycle Bin is located (usually on the system drive, e.g., C:). The software can potentially recover deleted files, including the INFO2 file, as long as the space it occupied has not been overwritten by new data.

--> Use a recovery tool to undelete the file

Selected Answer: C
When a user deletes a file or folder, the system stores the complete path, including the original filename, in a special hidden file called INFO2 in the Recycled folder. If the INFO2 file is deleted, it can be recovered when you use a recovery tool to undelete the file. Therefore, the correct answer is C.

choices.D: Download the file from Microsoft website
choices.A: Undo the last action performed on the system
choices.C: Use a recovery tool to undelete the file

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
nops-x86 is buffer overflow.

there is no other EVIDENCE in the log.
stop making assumptions.
CHFI is about understanding and FOLLOWING EVIDENCE AND PROCEDURE
NOP= no operations may indicate a buffer overflow. Answer B

Selected Answer: B
Jjweust is right

Selected Answer: A
A > Tricky one cause a buffer overflow [nops] is an IDS evasion technique.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Intrusion_detection_system_evasion_techniques

comments.content: Yeah, but if it is buffer overflow attack, than the correct answer is B.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A: An IDS evasion technique

The "nops-x86" log entry refers to a type of intrusion detection system (IDS) alert, indicating a potential attempt to evade detection. "NOP" is an assembly language instruction that does nothing but move the program counter to the next instruction. In computer security, NOP sleds or NOP slides are used in buffer overflow attacks to achieve code execution by overwriting a program's instruction pointer to point to the beginning of the NOP sled, causing the program to execute the attacker's code. The "x86" in the log entry refers to the architecture of the target system, likely a computer using an Intel x86-compatible CPU.
b. https://softwareengineering.stackexchange.com/questions/165002/purpose-of-nop-instruction-and-align-statement-in-x86-assembly/165031#165031

comments.content: Agree. This entry is taken from: https://repo.zenk-security.com/Forensic/A%20Forensic%20Analysis.pdf. On 26 April, at 06:43 snort alerted me that one of my systems had be attacked with a 'noop' attack. Packet payloads containing noops are an indication of a buffer overflow attack. Apr 26 06:43:05 lisa snort[6283]: IDS181/nops-x86: 63.226.81.13:1351 -> 172.16.1.107:53

discussion.content: B. A buffer overflow attempt

questions.question_text: What is the primary function of the tool CHKDSK in Windows that authenticates the file system reliability of a volume?

discussion.content:
The primary function of the CHKDSK (Check Disk) tool in Windows that authenticates the file system reliability of a volume is:

A. Repairs logical file system errors

CHKDSK scans and verifies the file system and disk metadata to ensure the integrity of the file system. It can also fix logical file system errors, such as correcting issues with directory structures and file allocation tables.

Selected Answer: A
CHFIv11 page 194 "you can use chkdsk..to scan and repair", even though on its own it's diagnostic only (you need to add params).

Selected Answer: A
A > Chkdsk.exe or Check Disk is a built-in Windows utility that helps detect errors in the file system and disk media.
A > checks the file system and file system metadata of a volume for logical and physical errors.
